name: Hilton Garden Inn Syracuse

reviews.text: This location is very convenient to my company. I've stayed here quite a few times. The staff is always friendly. The rooms always very clean and the restaurant/lounge is nice. I have noticed that it's not open in the winter on Sunday nights, so make sure to ask before you arrive, otherwise you will have to drive down the street to find something to eat. Breakfast in the morning is adequate. Great business hotel, very quiet.
reviews.title: Great for Business Trip

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night because I was attending a conference in the hotel. The room was very large, with separate bedroom and sitting rooms. I did not have a problem with any noise, but regarding the prior reviewer who experienced the noisy wedding reception- my room was directly across from one of the conference rooms. While I was getting settled in my room, music was playing on the conference room sound system and I was ready to complain and request to be moved because I could clearly hear it in my room which would drive me nuts. However, the music was turned off within a few minutes before I could complain and I had no further problem. But it seems clear that if your room is near a conference room, there could be an unfortunate noise problem. Enjoyed the pool, didn't have a whole lot of interaction with the staff. The hotel is located in an office park area, so there is no place nearby (shops, restaurants, etc.) to walk to. The location was fine for me because of the conference- but I would not likely stay here otherwise because it is not really near anything except office buildings.
reviews.title: Large room size was great

reviews.text: The hotel room I had was right next to the stairway and was very quiet. The curtains blocked out so much light that when my alarm went off I thought I had set it wrong since it was still really dark.
reviews.title: quiet rooms, light block curtains, friendly staff

reviews.text: The restaurant in the hotel was great. I had a lovely dinner and the waiter there was so friendly and just seemed happy to serve you.
reviews.title: Standard HGI

reviews.text: I prefer Hilton Garden Inns because they are usually a good value and have a bar/resturant on site (so you don't have to go out if you don't want to). This hotel was a bit isolated in an office park, but decent by most standards of the chain. We had snacks and a few beers at the bar, so I cant really comment on the food. There were lots of people in the bar area eating and I didnt see any leftovers. The staff was cheerful at the bar and the front desk. Breakfast was cooked to order and good, but the coffee was tepid - from the urn, the waitress and a supposedly fresh brewed pot. Overall I would return again because it was close to my meeting site and only 10 minutes to downtown resturants.
reviews.title: Worse hotel ever

reviews.text: The room was clean and the staff very nice, but the room was smaller than the other Garden Inns we've stayed at. The manager's reception with a cocktail and finger foods was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Small, but OK

reviews.text: The pool, spa, and exercise room were all identical to the other Garden Inn's we've been to, they were fine.
reviews.title: good business hotel
Great place to stay in Syracuse
reviews.text: Overall, a great stay at a great price, but the room was small. I wouldn't say this is a great family place, but not bad for a business traveler.

Stayed on business for 2 nights. The hotel was clean, staff was appropriate (nothing out of the ordinary, but professional). Pool was small. Gym had 2 treadmills, 1 eliptical machine, 1 stationary bike and a few weight machines. The hotel stated they had wireless internet access, but was unable to connect to it. Cabled high speed internet worked well tho. Little restaraunt was adequate, a bit spendy on the drinks, but food was decent. Very good place to stay for business.
reviews.title: Convenient
I liked it
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip. My corporate rate for a room was $85. I got a King handicapped accessible room that had a couch, ottoman, desk, armoire w/TV. There was also a microwave and a small a refrigerator. There's also a coffeemaker in the room. The bathroom was clean. The front desk staff were polite. There are free cookies at the desk in the evenings.

reviews.title: Bad experience at this hotel
reviews.text: There is a pool with whirlpool, that I didn't use.
The restaurant/pub serves food. I had a burger and it was OK.
reviews.title: uneven-don't leave things in room!

likes.disliked: — Buffet food, Internet Service can be spotty

reviews.text: The breakfast is similar to the Embassy Suites, except the cost isn't included in the room rate.
reviews.title: Fine

reviews.text: The directions from the airport aren't as easy as they may seem at first look. This hotel is set apart from others in a relatively industrial area.
reviews.title: Awful! The Worst HGI ever!!!

reviews.text: Hotel is a nice site, with clean rooms. Quite area. The restaurant is an embarassment to the Hilton name. If the restaurant was a stand alone business serving this food, the doors would have been closed long ago. They charge prices that are on par with fine restaurants, but serve food reminiscent of a snack bar. A whopper from Burger King has 10 times the taste and flavor of their $11 burger. Wilted lettuce filled the salad. $10 for a glass of wine!!!! Overcooked and mushy vegetables. Pasta sauce was tasteless, canned variety. I didn'expect much until I saw the prices, then thought to myself that you can't get away with charging those prices unless the food is decent, WRONG. Steer clear of the Wild Goose! They should convert it to a bar with snack food and leave the fine dining to someone else.
reviews.title: Good hotel, terrible, shameful restaurant

reviews.text: Nice hotel in secluded part of town which is great if you want to avoid traffic and noise. Decent rooms. But staff mediocre at best. The older blonde at the front desk is really distant. The night we were there a bunch of teenagers were running the corridors at 1130pm. I expressed concern upon arrival when I saw them all in the lobby. I asked if at the front desk if that was a sports group. They said No, it is a conservative Jewish group and they won't be a problem. Well, it was a problem at 1130pm I will tell you.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.text: Front desk staff is usually very friendly. The rooms are always clean. Although I request to be away from smoking rooms.
reviews.title: One of my favorites in Carrier Circle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pub is ok. I have had food that ranged from average to verygood there.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Very clean hotel. Very friendly staff. If fragrances bother you, you may want to avoid this hotel though. They have air freshners in the hallways, which smell very nice, but may annoy someone with a sensitive nose.
reviews.title: Nice stay

likes.liked: — Convenient and clean, great desk staff.

description: The Hilton Garden Inn Syracuse, is in the eastern suburb of Syracuse, near companies such as Carrier, New Venture Gear, Bristol Meyer Squibb, and Time Warner Cable. The hotel is situated in the Pioneer office park, offering a campus-like setting. Deluxe accommodations, friendly service, and a relaxed atmosphere await our guests. Certain to please the busy executive or leisure traveler to the Syracuse, New York area are our array of special amenities, including complimentary high-speed internet access with secure PrinterOn remote printing, an in-room hospitality center with microwave, refrigerator, coffeemaker, two dual-line phones with voicemail and data ports, a large work desk, ergonomic chair, On Demand® video, TV video games, complimentary HBO® and a complimentary USA Today® each weekday morning.
